text: Hey guys! Need your brains here. I need to build a multiple step form and be able to send a link to people who are quitting in the process so they can take it where they left.. I don't think the built in cookies would be enough.. Especially if they open the link in another device. so I was wondering if we can do something more with API's or else

In the past I've used a slider (e.g. Slick, Flickity) with an embedded form on each slide. That way you can trigger a workflow if they've submitted the form on slide 3 but not on slide 4 (for example). When they return to the page the cookies should have pre-populated data so they can click back through to slide 4 easily enough (it'll resubmit each form). You could also custom code fields and use the Forms API (handy when you want to do something like att in a calculation at the end).
Or the API is handy if you want them to move back and forth between slides (with a submitted form they'd just see a thank you message on the previous slide).

Hey, does anyone know who owns the <https://website.grader.com/> tool?
I noticed that it now reports out of date JS Libraries and calls it a Security hole... with no explanation or detail.
Few stakeholders on my end now believe our sites are unsecure, which of course they likely aren't
Help pls
In one dropdown i need to have all states of the USA as options. Is there a way to import this or do i have to create them from scratch?
You have this built-in HubSpot properties: <https://share.vidyard.com/watch/qZA6NiDyfg7Bi8vXSb3zXp>?

Is anyone having problems with CSS/JS caching when developing DND templates? I noticed this when i was in Preview Mode and I make any CSS changes it seems to be caching the previous styles and I am forced to add an additional semicolon after a style, save, remove the added semicolon, save and my changes are reflected.

I submit using the forms api. I have all the forms required items turned off, and use my code to make items required. On the button to go to the next page, I submit that pages answers to the form.  That is the simple explanation
I kinda like <@UBUNBSM24>’s way.. a lot less moving parts for a client that doesnt need all the fancy bells and whistles (and doesn't have the budget)
yes but how can I generate a link that would make them land where they left?
Hopefully someone at HubSpot can help with this.  I'd also look at which libraries need updates -- if it is just jquery then that is terrible and likely unfixable.
you could show them 100 other websites from HubSpot that all have this
some tools on here:  <https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/vulnerabilities>
I think this may be related to the minification for the styles. Shouldn't minification be disabled in Preview Mode for proper development?
are you just using the `?hs_preview=CywocCKw-26958300377` type of url, correct?

Generally that works for me. I believe the internet in a whole has been suffering so things are taking a bit longer in general to work properly.  In desperate times I'll put the `&hsDebug=TRUE`  on the end of the preview link, hoping that solves, and if not get my module css file loaded up in a new tab and hard refresh that, then main window.

you could do this a few ways... the way I think I'd go is by updating the url
```window.history.pushState({ form1: true, form2: false, form3: false }, 'Multi Panel Form Page Title', '/your-form-page#form2');```
So that would update the url so the user can copy/paste. I'd also put some intro text and input box at the top/bottom of form saying Your form progress has been saved, click copy button to copy url to return back later if you'd like.
yeah correct i am using that preview url but still getting issues with caching.
ill try debug
on document /window (depending on the slider) ready/load I'd do a check to `const formId = window.location.hash`
then hit the next button or advance the slide to the proper form...
does that make sense?
yes but this relies on HubSpot cookies to bind the returning visitors with the contact created on step 1, no?
yes
do they have marketing enterprise? then you can do a membership with a login/password

if not -- a work around would be to have a form that pops up if you don't know the (hubl) contact email, pop up a form. to complete your form, type in your email... on form submit do some javascript to time out for 3-4 seconds, then redirect back to the page you are on
I want something like <http://mysite.com/form-2?vid=12345|mysite.com/form-2?vid=12345> or <mailto:mysite.com/form-2?email=lead@company.com|mysite.com/form-2?email=lead@company.com>
you could do that, but it won't auto populate if the cookies aren't there
yes I know, but at least it wont create a new contact.
HMM
interesting
you would have email on each form, you'd have to. So it would auto populate and automaticaly answer...

What I want to prevent is I start the process on device 1 with <mailto:myemail1@company.com|myemail1@company.com> and continue the process on device 2 with <mailto:myemail2@company.com|myemail2@company.com> so it creates two contacts instead of one
as long as none of those inputs in the other forms are reliant on previous forms answers -- that might be a good work around
yeah, the link would need to include the email <mailto:email=email@email.com|email=email@email.com>
that would fill the form field
good idea
when you get it figured out, If you need someone to test it out, lmk
I'll try it
Thanks
I will let the team know
It works perfectly <http://challengeu-7301089.hs-sites.com/form-1>
no fancy coding
created 3 landing pages
3 forms
nice
the in between page reload is a little bit frustrating but for a cheap & quick solution that would do the trick
yup

HI folks! Is the HubSpot user token `HubSpotutk` used once a contact is in HubSpot? because it doesn’t seem present inside of a user’s properties… unles it is a hidden one  How is it generated (I know it’s the tracking code). Thanks!
:thumbsup:

Hi. Regarding forms — it looks like, for testing, HS rejects @test.com and @example.com. Are there any other addresses, that anyone knows of, that are automatically rejected? I want to pass those on to our QC team so they don’t test with those.
thanks Louis!

It is definitely used, but it’s not really exposed anywhere.  It’s generated by the tracking code as you noted then associated to contacts as can match that up with an email address, usually through Forms submisions, but this can also be set through the tracking code API
ok thank you!

I think qc should be using their email address, that way they can test if emails are being delivered, or you create a <mailto:qc@yourdomain.com|qc@yourdomain.com> that forwards to team. -- Then you can have the contact open, delete contact if you need to clean data
prevents a bunch of users being added, leads being added, etc and prevents unintended data manipulation
sorry, that doesn't answer your question lol
this is all stuff that’s eventually cleared out. they have multiple QC addresses, but then sometimes they can’t test as an “unknown” user when they’re already in the system.
ahh, makes sense
everything is set to exclude traffic from our agency’s IPs as well
in HubSpot and GA?
as far as possible, yes
i’m not on the marketing side, but i know there’s stuff they’ve done in HS to exclude our traffic from lead flows and such
definitely in GA; i think that’s the first thing our analytics team sets up

Is there some sort of crawler/user agent string I can use with HubSpot to not receive cached content? I have an external search application that crawls a site, but it isn't pulling in updated meta content in the head because it is seeing cached content.

Hi, can you share some URLs that are cached? We don’t want a crawler to aggressively hit our servers. So we serve cached content to bots, but we invalidate the cache as soon as we see the contents are updated.
sent a dm
Hey everyone, wondering if anyone knows exactly which plan should I opt-in / upgrade to get the ability to fully customize the forms via CSS? Thank you.

<@U25PYL3Q8> totally agree, it probably is jquery, but on this particular client site (which isnt even HubSpot COS), it is creating an unnecessary sense of fear among marketers who use this tool. Which we all know is nothing but a marketing tool. I dont disagree its accurate, but I need more data from the tool to explain why. <@U22PJPGK0> appreciate any help here mate.
The team has been discussing. I’ll ask them to respond.

Hi there! I am part of the team that works on this tool. Really appreciate the discussion and feedback.

• We use <https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse|Google Lighthouse> behind the scenes to generate all the recommendations. The "Secure JavaScript Libraries" check specifically uses <https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/vulnerabilities|this> Lighthouse audit. 
• For HubSpot-hosted websites, you can disable jQuery by going to Settings >> Website >> Pages >> Templates, and scrolling to the bottom of the page. I believe we now also automatically turn off jQuery for all newly created portals. 
• I agree we should do a better job of highlighting _why_ the audit failed. We are working on some additional documentation and resources that we will link to from the tool to help with that. For the time being, running a Lighthouse scan against the site will give you the necessary info.

<@UHM5BT6G5> would you recommend disabling jquery and adding a more secure/newer version? Is there anything legacy wise that we will need to adjust in portals to prevent errors/deprecated code from what HubSpot provides?
What do you have right now?

> <@UHM5BT6G5> would you recommend disabling jquery and adding a more secure/newer version? Is there anything legacy wise that we will need to adjust in portals to prevent errors/deprecated code from what HubSpot provides?
<@U22PJPGK0> - since you are closer to the jQuery work, mind taking this one?
I have the free HubSpot marketing and I embed forms on my wordpress site and I’m able to edit css of forms
Lol maybe I can’t
